intro: Ardisia hylandii, commonly known as the Hawaiian beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Myrsinaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Ardisia hylandii typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas. Its ornamental value has made it a subject of ecological and horticultural interest.
